objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to propose 'Acceleron', a tool designed to assist researchers during the ideation phase of the research life cycle by guiding them through the formulation of a comprehensive research proposal.
objective.evidence: To aid with research ideation, we propose ‘Acceleron’, a research accelerator for different phases of the research life cycle, and which is specially designed to aid the ideation process.

knowledge_gap.answer: There is a significant gap in the availability of tools specifically designed to assist researchers during the challenging ideation phase of the research life-cycle.
knowledge_gap.evidence: Our investigation reveals a significant gap in availability of tools specifically designed to assist researchers during the challenging ideation phase of the research life-cycle.

answer: Introduction of LLM agents with colleague and mentor personas to assist in the ideation process.
Mitigation of hallucination in LLMs through retrieval augmented components and user interactions.
Implementation of a two-stage aspect-based retrieval to manage precision-recall trade-offs.
Introduction of unanswerability in retrieval tasks to reduce irrelevant outputs.
evidence: We have devised with two novel portfolios for LLMS, viz., colleague and mentor, allocating less complex tasks to the colleague agent and more complex reasoning based tasks to the mentor agent.

We mitigate this problem using a two-fold solution: (i) There are retrieval augmented components of the workflows... (ii) There are components of the workflows which rely on parametric knowledge of LLMs...

To achieve this we perform retrieval in two stages. In motivation validation workflow, we first retrieve top-K papers from the global corpus with the proposal as the query and high value of K for good recall.

In such cases, the LLM based agents check the relevancy of retrieved paragraphs for the given query and identifies the query as ‘unanswerable’ in case if all the retrieved paragraphs are irrelevant, avoiding irrelevant outputs.

inspirational_papers.answer: - Cohan et al. (2020) SPECTER: Document-level Representation Learning using Citation-informed Transformers. (Methodological precursors)
inspirational_papers.evidence: We expect to have a global repository which is a vector store of domain specific scientific articles which are indexed by the Specter embeddings (Cohan et al. 2020) produced using the paper’s title and abstract.

steps.input: Title and abstract of the proposal
steps.evidence: The researcher provides the title and abstract of the proposal elaborating the motivation behind the proposal and a high level description of the problem statement the research wishes to solve.
The method synthesis phase begins with the proposal whose motivation is validated based on reviewing the literature and accepted by the researcher.

tools.name: LLM Agents
tools.description: Used for performing tasks such as extracting motivation, generating questions, and synthesizing methods.
tools.evidence: We define an LLM Agent based architecture, with agents of two distinct types of profiles or personas.

methods.name: Hypothesis or Idea Generation
methods.description: The system produces candidate hypotheses or new research ideas from prior knowledge or external input.
methods.evidence: The process involves interaction between a researcher and the LLM agents, where the LLM agents perform actions based on the feedback received by the researcher or another agent.

methods.name: Experimental design generation
methods.description: The approach includes producing experimental protocols, configurations, or evaluation strategies.
methods.evidence: The mentor agent uses these gaps along with the original proposal to re-formulate the motivation and the problem statement of the proposal to address the new research gaps.

areas.name: Interdisciplinary Sciences
areas.description: The tool is designed to assist in the ideation phase across various scientific domains.
areas.evidence: We plan to augment the ideation functionality of the tool for other scientific domains such as life-sciences or material sciences, etc.

areas.name: Applied Sciences & Engineering
areas.description: The tool leverages LLMs to assist in research ideation, which is applicable in engineering and applied sciences.
areas.evidence: The recent advancement in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI) has made it possible to partially automate some of these tasks.

performance_summary.summary: The tool demonstrates precise outcomes for various stages in the workflow with approximately 7.5x gains in time efficiency for the ideation phase.
performance_summary.evidence: The qualitative analysis performed with three proposals from distinct researchers, in the domain of Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, demonstrates precise outcomes for various stages in the workflow with ∼7.5x gains in the time efficiency for various stages of the ideation phase.
